page.title: 07Education In 1985
page.content: There are two types of schools today, Primary and Comprehensive. Children start Infants school at 4 years of age.When they are 7 years old they go to Junior school.These schools are usually small on average 180 pupils and half a dozen staff.They mainly study English and Maths.Children do not wear uniform. When children are 11 they move on to Comprehensive school.These schools are a lot bigger with far more staff.They study a lot more subjects such as History,Geography,Music,French,German and Technical Studies.Pupils have an exam every year and when pupils are 16 years old they do 'O' levels or C.S.E's.They can leave when they are 16 or stay to study 'A' levels in the sixth form.They then leave school when they are 18 years old.
